metadata.feature_description: Provides integration points for social modules like Answers, Blogs, and Discussions.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Activity Stream social module filter integration

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream module
steps.expected: Activity Stream page loads with social module content
steps.actual: Activity Stream page loaded successfully showing Community content and social features

steps.expected: Activity Stream displays social content from various modules
steps.actual: Activity Stream displayed with community content and user interaction features

steps.action: Click Activity filter dropdown to see available social module types
steps.expected: Dropdown shows filter options for various social modules (Forums, Wiki, Answers, etc.)
steps.actual: Filter dropdown displayed all social module types: Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Forum Replies, Friends, Group Created, Group Joined, Added to Wiki, Updated Wiki, Added a Document, Updated a Document, Added an Article, Added a Video, Comment, Questions, Answers, Created Event

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Wiki module integration with user social profile

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki page under Community section
steps.expected: Wiki page loads with article listing and user social profile sidebar
steps.actual: Wiki page loaded showing 30 articles with user profile sidebar displaying social module counters: My Articles (40), My Questions (0), My Blog Entries (0), My Topics (0), My Ideas (1), My Events (0), and Bookmarks (2)

observations: The EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs code defines KnownSocialModules list containing: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events, Wiki, Challenges
The FindFirstSocialModuleOnPage() method automatically detects social modules on the current page and integrates them with the PersonaBar
Social module integration is implemented as automatic/contextual detection rather than a separate menu item in Admin > PersonaBar > Social Features
The Activity Stream filter dropdown provides comprehensive integration with all social module content types
User profile sidebar on social module pages (Wiki, etc.) shows aggregated counts from all social modules (Articles, Questions, Blog Entries, Topics, Ideas, Events)
No explicit 'Social Features' menu was found in PersonaBar - the integration is embedded within the Activity Stream and social module pages themselves
